project.teaser: The shipping industry is responsible for around 3% of global greenhouse gas emissions, and this is expected to increase as global trade and shipping activity continues to grow. As such, reducing emissions from shipping is an important part of global efforts to tackle climate...
project.objective:
The shipping industry is responsible for around 3% of global greenhouse gas emissions, and this is expected to increase as global trade and shipping activity continues to grow. As such, reducing emissions from shipping is an important part of global efforts to tackle climate change. In recent years, policies and legislation, mainly focusing on environmental sustainability, have pushed international shipping toward the process of its decarbonization. Regulatory bodies are pressing on the maritime world by adopting ambitious targets and by introducing a number of initiatives that will facilitate the transition to a sustainable future, including the International Maritime Organization's strategy to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from shipping, which aims to halve emissions from the sector by 2050 compared to 2008 levels.
To this end, BlueBARGE will design, develop and demonstrate an optimum power-barge solution to mainly support offshore power supply to moored and anchored vessels, limiting local polluting emissions and global GHG footprint in a life cycle perspective, following a modular, scalable, adaptable and flexible design approach which will facilitate its commercialisation by 2030. The proposed power-barge solution will consider different alternatives as containerised power supply modules in a variety of configurations, where battery modules will serve as basis due to their high energy efficiency and readiness level, and other considered modules including hydrogen fuel cells and hydrogen generators. The project will address electrical integration issues, interfacing challenges of the barge with ships, ports and local grid, operational safety and regulatory compliance aspects, delivering a high-readiness and complete “power bunkering” solution. Overall, the BlueBARGE project’s full integrated system aims at contributing to the shift of the maritime industry towards the goals of electrification and decarbonisation at an EU and international level.
project.title: Blue Bunkering of Anchored ships with Renewable Generated Electricity
project.keywords: Electrification Anchoring Ships Power Supply Anchorage Power Barge OPS Offshore Power Supply Onshore Power Supply

article.title: A new and sustainable power barge solution

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: [T1.4] This deliverable will provide the plan for presenting all data types that the project intends to collate, and will esnure necessary approvals needed from national data protection authorities.

result.title: Communication and dissemination plan
result.description: [T8.1, T8.2] This deliverable will include the dissemination plan. More specifically, a series of dissemination and communication activities will be enclosed for the consortium to materialise.

result.title: Performance assessment framework and KPIs
result.description: [T4.1] This deliverable will present the framework for assessing the performance of the power-barge solution alternatives, as well as the optimisation of the promoted solution. In this sense, it will include an analysis on the KPIs to be used in the framework.

result.title: BlueBARGE use cases, technical specifications and requirements
result.description: [T2.1, T2.2] This deliverable will include definition and detail description of the use cases for the power-barge, as well as the process for their realisation. Consequent specifications, mainly for power demand, but also with respect to waiting hours and infrastructure will be included as well. Finally, the deliverable will highlight the technical, operational and safety requirements identified within the context of T2.2 from the systems engineering approach.

result.title: Project Quality and Risk Management
result.description: [T1.3] This deliverable will provide the detailed procedures that will be utilised by the Consortium for assuring the conformity and the quality of all project deliverables with the respective requirements, allowing the realisation of internal assessment of the project on a 6-month basis. In addition, it will cover the procedures for risk assessment, where risks will be constantly assessed and evaluated within the whole project duration

result.title: Project Administrative and Financial Management
result.description: [T1.1, T1.2, T1.5] This deliverable will provide a comprehensive Project Management Plan and the detailed procedures in order to enable efficient coordination among Consortium members and communication with EC, managing effectively financial issues and monitoring the project's progress. Deliverable will also include details relevant to the establishment and activities of the Advisory Board.

result.title: Ethics Compliance
result.description: Regarding handling ethical requirements during the potential collection and processing of personal data of human participants external to the consortium, such as external workshops, demonstration activities, etc., the deliverable will include:• the procedures and criteria that will be used to identify/recruit participants;• information on the informed consent procedures that will be implemented for the participation of humans;• templates of the informed consent forms and information sheet;• detailed information on the procedures that will be implemented for data collection, storage, protection, retention, and destruction, and confirmation that they comply with national and EU legislation;• detailed information on the informed consent procedures that will be implemented in regard to the collection, storage, and protection of personal data.

result.title: Data Management Plan - rev.1
result.description: [T1.4] The first revision of the Data Management Plan, providing updates on data types and approvals needed, as project progresses.

result.title: Defining the Power and Energy Demands from Ships at Anchorage for Offshore Power Supply Solutions

details.authors: Nikolaos P. Ventikos, Panagiotis Sotiralis, Manolis Annetis, Marios-Anestis Koimtzoglou, Lina Keratsa

result.title: Power supply modules and microgrid specifications
result.description: [T3.1] This deliverable will report on the electrification specification for the BlueBARGE modules, both the power supply modules and the integration and interfacing modules. Outcome will drive the design of the modules.

category.title: climatic changes
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/atmospheric sciences/climatology/climatic changes

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
